page.title: 02Bathgate Gala Day
page.content: In Bathgate every year we have Newland's Day Procession. This is to commemorate John Newland, who financed a school to be built in Bathgate. THE PROCESSION In the morning various bands play around Bathgate then every one taking part assembles at The Old Academy(The school John Newland financed.) The pageant begins with the leading characters, being Princess Marjory and Walter, The Lord High Steward. There are also spearsmen, clansmen, bowmen, flowergirls, rainbow girls, King Robert the Bruce and various other members of the royal court. The Procession begins starting with a banner, with Alexander Marjoribank's face on it, who built the school after John Newland died. In the Procession there are majorettes, brass bands, decorated flo
